revised_title: Strata Observations and Salt Springs in Boston, Lincolnshire
tldr: This article describes the strata observed during well-boring for water in Boston, Lincolnshire, and the discovery of salt springs at various depths. The author, James Limbird, provides a detailed account of the layers of earth, clay, stone, and gravel encountered while boring, as well as the challenges faced during the process. The salt springs discovered at different depths offer insights into the local geology and groundwater resources.
